title: Introduction
serviceInfo: Complete and submit an ET3 response form when someone makes an employment tribunal claim against you.
infoTxt: If you're a legal professional or another type of professional who received a 16-digit reference number in your response pack, you can
infoTxtLink: respond online using a MyHMCTS account (opens in new tab).
whatYouNeedHeading: What you need for this form
whatYouNeedListTxt1: your case number (on the letter we sent you)
whatYouNeedListTxt2: claimant's employment start and end dates, hours of work and period of notice
whatYouNeedListTxt3: details of claimant's pay and benefits, before and after tax
whatYouNeedListTxt4: any Acas Early Conciliation details you may have, such as the certificate number
whatYouNeedListTxt5: a description of your response to the claim, including dates and the people involved
whatYouNeedListTxt6: details of your representative, like a solicitor, if you have one
howToCompleteFormHeading: How to fill in the form
howToCompleteFormListTxt1: your information will not be saved if you spend longer than 1 hour on a single page
howToCompleteFormListTxt2: you can review and edit your answers before you submit the form
howToCompleteFormListTxt3: you can save a PDF of your form after you submit it
dataProtectionTxt1: We will send a copy of this form to the claimant and the Advisory, Conciliation and Arbitration Service (ACAS). We will put the information you give us on this form onto a computer. This helps us to monitor progress and produce statistics. Information provided on this form is passed to the Department for Business, Innovation and Skills to assist research into the use and effectiveness of employment tribunals.
claimStartedTxt: Have you already started a response?
contactUsHelpTxt: Call one of our Employment Tribunal customer contact centres. They cannot give you legal advice.
moreFromLinkTxt: More from the Working, jobs and pensions category
